intro: Gonostegia hirta, commonly known as the hairy gonostegia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Gonostegia hirta is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forests.
